intro: Bidens cusickii, commonly known as Cusick's ironweed, is a flowering plant native to the central and eastern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and serrated leaves. The plant typically grows in moist to wet habitats such as marshes, swamps, and along stream banks. Its bright yellow flowers bloom in late summer and early fall, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. The plant has rough, hairy stems and is often found in wetland ecosystems, contributing to the biodiversity of these habitats.
